titleInfo.title: Photograph of Freshman Class of LeMoyne College, 1941-42

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Black and white photograph of 1941 freshman class of LeMoyne College, taken in front of Brown Lee Hall on the campus of LeMoyne College in Memphis, Tennessee. The class is arranged in four rows. Many of the people in the photograph are identified by Lovelle Fouse Jenkins. Future civil rights leader Reverend Benjamin L. Hooks is in the far right on the back row of the photograph. LeMoyne-Owen College is a private HBCU that opened during the Civil War. LeMoyne merged with Owen College in 1968, and is still in operation today.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
